trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: In the top left of the window, click the **+NEW** button > **Web + Mobile** > **Mobile App**, then provide a name for your Mobile App backend.
trans-unit.target: In the top left of the window, click the **+NEW** button > **Web + Mobile** > **Mobile App**, then provide a name for your Mobile App backend.

trans-unit.source: In the **Resource Group** box, select an existing resource group.
trans-unit.target: In the **Resource Group** box, select an existing resource group.

trans-unit.source: If you have no resource groups, enter the same name as your app.
trans-unit.target: If you have no resource groups, enter the same name as your app.

trans-unit.source: At this point, the default App Service plan is selected, which is in the Free tier.
trans-unit.target: At this point, the default App Service plan is selected, which is in the Free tier.

trans-unit.source: The App Service plan settings determine the location, features, cost and compute resources associated with your app.
trans-unit.target: The App Service plan settings determine the location, features, cost and compute resources associated with your app.

trans-unit.source: You can either select another App Service plan or create a new one.
trans-unit.target: You can either select another App Service plan or create a new one.

trans-unit.source: For more about App Services plans and how to create a new plan, see [Azure App Service plans in-depth overview](../app-service/azure-web-sites-web-hosting-plans-in-depth-overview.md)
trans-unit.target: For more about App Services plans and how to create a new plan, see [Azure App Service plans in-depth overview](../app-service/azure-web-sites-web-hosting-plans-in-depth-overview.md)

trans-unit.source: Use the default App Service plan, select a different plan or [create a new plan](../app-service/azure-web-sites-web-hosting-plans-in-depth-overview.md#create-an-app-service-plan), then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Use the default App Service plan, select a different plan or [create a new plan](../app-service/azure-web-sites-web-hosting-plans-in-depth-overview.md#create-an-app-service-plan), then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: This creates the Mobile App backend.
trans-unit.target: This creates the Mobile App backend.

trans-unit.source: Later you will deploy your server project to this backend.
trans-unit.target: Later you will deploy your server project to this backend.

trans-unit.source: Provisioning a Mobile App backend can take several minutes; the **Settings** blade for the Mobile App backend is displayed when complete.
trans-unit.target: Provisioning a Mobile App backend can take several minutes; the **Settings** blade for the Mobile App backend is displayed when complete.

trans-unit.source: Before you can use the Mobile App backend, you must also define a connection a data store.
trans-unit.target: Before you can use the Mobile App backend, you must also define a connection a data store.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] As part of this tutorial, you create a new SQL Database instance and server.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] As part of this tutorial, you create a new SQL Database instance and server.

trans-unit.source: You can reuse this new database and administer it as you would any other SQL Database instance.
trans-unit.target: You can reuse this new database and administer it as you would any other SQL Database instance.

trans-unit.source: If you already have a database in the same location as the new mobile app backend, you can instead choose **Use an existing database** and then select that database.
trans-unit.target: If you already have a database in the same location as the new mobile app backend, you can instead choose **Use an existing database** and then select that database.

trans-unit.source: The use of a database in a different location is not recommended because of additional bandwidth costs and higher latencies.
trans-unit.target: The use of a database in a different location is not recommended because of additional bandwidth costs and higher latencies.

trans-unit.source: Other data storage options are available.
trans-unit.target: Other data storage options are available.

trans-unit.source: In the **Settings** blade for the new Mobile App backend, click **Quick start** > your client app platform > **Connect a database**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Settings** blade for the new Mobile App backend, click **Quick start** > your client app platform > **Connect a database**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add data connection** blade, click **SQL Database** > **Create a new database**, type the database **Name**, choose a pricing tier, then click **Server**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Add data connection** blade, click **SQL Database** > **Create a new database**, type the database **Name**, choose a pricing tier, then click **Server**.

trans-unit.source: In the **New server** blade, type a unique server name in the **Server name** field, provide a secure **Server admin login** and **Password**, make sure that **Allow azure services to access server** is checked, then click **OK** twice.
trans-unit.target: In the **New server** blade, type a unique server name in the **Server name** field, provide a secure **Server admin login** and **Password**, make sure that **Allow azure services to access server** is checked, then click **OK** twice.

trans-unit.source: This creates the new database and server.
trans-unit.target: This creates the new database and server.

trans-unit.source: Back in the **Add data connection** blade, click **Connection string**, type the login and password values for your database, then click **OK** twice.
trans-unit.target: Back in the **Add data connection** blade, click **Connection string**, type the login and password values for your database, then click **OK** twice.

trans-unit.source: Creation of the database can take a few minutes.
trans-unit.target: Creation of the database can take a few minutes.

trans-unit.source: Use the **Notifications** area to monitor the progress of the deployment.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Notifications** area to monitor the progress of the deployment.

trans-unit.source: You cannot continue until the database has been deployed sucessfully.
trans-unit.target: You cannot continue until the database has been deployed sucessfully.
